poem:
Title: "Of Soaring Pixels and Human Ambition" 

A leap and a bound in digitized dreams,  
Driven by invisible currents of value.  
Through the $60,000 door, it teems  
The new gold, in cyberspace hue.

Past the transient high of November's perch,  
Yet suspended in the shadow of a plummet,  
A virtual chase, an endless search,  
Both its boon and the comet.

Through the rhythm of rise and fall, we trace  
The ebb and flow of our insatiable race.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Bitcoin surges through $60,000 in biggest monthly rally since late 2020 – as it happened 3.01pm GMT Closing summary Bitcoin has jumped through $60,000, rising 7.5% today, as the cryptocurrency stages its biggest monthly rally since late 2020. The surge to $60,900 means it is pushing closer to its all-time high of more than $68,000 in November 2021 – which was followed by a spectacular crash in 2022. The world’s best-known cryptocurrency has been buoyed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Bitcoin surges through $60,000 in biggest monthly rally since late 2020 – as it happened 3.01pm GMT Closing summary Bitcoin has jumped through $60,000, rising 7.5% today, as the cryptocurrency stages its biggest monthly rally since late 2020. The surge to $60,900 means it is pushing closer to its all-time high of more than $68,000 in November 2021 – which was followed by a spectacular crash in 2022. The world’s best-known cryptocurrency has been buoyed
